Class XOAuth2Auth

  • java.lang.Object
    • XOAuth2Auth
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Auth, ExitCodes
    public class XOAuth2Auth
extends Object
implements Auth, ExitCodes
    Class to handle XOAUTH2 SMTP authentication method. Sets up and executes a Python script (auth.py) as a subprocess, which returns an OAuth access token to the parent.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private static String[] EXE_CMD
      Subprocess command for when a Python interpreter is not available in the PATH.
      private static String[] INT_CMD
      Subprocess command for when a Python interpreter is available in the PATH.

    • Method Detail

      • getCmd

        private static String[] getCmd()
        Determines the command to use for XOAUTH2 subprocess.

        Scans through the PATH environment variable to see if a Python interpreter is present in the path. If one is found, it is used with auth.py. Otherwise, a precompiled binary (WINDOWS ONLY!!!) is used. If it does not exist in the current directory, it will be extracted from the jar archive, executed, and deleted on program exit.

        Returns:
        And array to use with ProcessBuilder for the XOAUTH2 subprocess.

      • verifyEnvFile

        private boolean verifyEnvFile()
        Validates the OAuth environment file.

        Checks the .env file containing needed fields for OAuth requests (Client ID, Client Secret) is present and contains the needed data.

        Returns:
        true if the file exists and contains the needed data, false if the file exists and does not contain the needed data

      • buildAuthString

        public byte[] buildAuthString​(String user)
        Creates the argument to the AUTH XOAUTH2 command.

        Executes the Python subprocess and processes the returned access token to return the base64 encoded argument to the AUTH command.

        Specified by:
        buildAuthString in interface Auth
        Parameters:
        user - Username for authentication.
        Returns:
        Argument to AUTH command
